text:
Active Atheism

These huge caricatures of the Church & Czarism, made by New York Communists, are like those constantly used in Russian antireligious propaganda.

These grotesque figures may have meant a great deal to real grown- up r e d s at meeting in Starlight Park, th Bronx, in New York City, March 16th, 1930, but they were just amusing toys to the youngsters gathered about them. The figure at left represents the Church - (Rasputin, the Black Monk) and at right is Imperialism in figure of Nicholas - Czar of all the Russians.
title: Bronx: Starlight Park.

text:
Starlight Amusement Park (Bronx): Viewing east across the Bronx River and the park's swimming pool.

P. L. Sperr
July 23, 1940
title: Bronx: Starlight Amusement Park.

text:
Starlight Amusement Park (Bronx): The south end of the park showing the swimming pool and reservoir, seen from the E. 174th Street bridge over the Bronx River. The entrance to the park is on the south side of E. 177th Street, at Devoe Avenue.

July 18, 1928
Views 1, 2

P. L. Sperr

(3)

The same, years later.

July 23, 1940.
